newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss fund manager held for losing client millions.
newsitem.headline: Swiss fund manager held for losing client millions.

text.p: Police have arrested a Geneva fund manager on charges of causing client losses amounting to more than $20 million in speculative dealings in U.S. shares, Swiss news agency ATS reported on Friday.

The agency said the unidentified asset manager was arrested on Wednesday after two of his clients lodged a formal complaint with Geneva police, accusing him of portfolio losses caused by speculation on the U.S. electronic stock market Nasdaq.
ATS said the fund manager had assets worth some 200 million Swiss francs ($135 million) under management. He was working for a firm which had just recently been licensed.
No other details were immediately available.
Growing competition in the Swiss private banking and asset management market has seen a swarm of new asset management companies battling over the pool of capital.
Many are boutique-type operations working with a small number of staff, trying to gain business in a market where investors are demanding lower fees and higher returns.
They share the market with established, old Swiss private banks and such well-capitalised Wall Street powerhouses as Merrill Lynch and Bankers Trust.
Switzerland holds an estimated 40 percent of the private wealth managed offshore and some $1.8 trillion in client assets under management, according to recent Swiss bank surveys.
